spec.name: Villa Mirador
spec.description: Villa Mirador is a residential villa of immense historical importance, located in the Anfa district. During World War II, it was reportedly one of the sites used by the **US Embassy** in Morocco. Most famously, the villa **hosted Winston Churchill** during the pivotal **Anfa Conference** (Casablanca Conference) in January 1943, where Allied leaders discussed the strategy for the European theater. The villa is a key physical relic of the city's role in World War II diplomacy.
